New Documentary Film Produced 
   Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- The Korean Documentary and Scientific Film Studio recently produced the documentary film "Eight Sceneries in the Era of Songun."
 The film tells the sunrise over Mt. Paektu shedding brilliant rays all over the land is the first scenic beauty in Songun Korea as it represents the acme of majestic, fascinating and mysterious scenery.    
 The film shows that the rest of the eight sceneries in the era of Songun are the snow-covered Tapaksol post under beautiful young pine trees, royal azaleas in full bloom on Chol pass which present spectacular scenery along the pass road, ridges and valleys, the brightly lit River Jangja showing the true appearance of the country which has brought about great changes and miracles despite rigorous trials, the echo of Ullim falls, the horizon over the Handre Plane, potato flowers in Taehongdan County and the beautiful scenery of Poman-ri.

Congratulatory Message to Brazilian President 
   Pyongyang, November 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a congratulatory message to Luiz Inacio Lula Da Silva on his reelection as President of Brazil.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and two peoples would grow stronger in different fields in the future and wished the President greater success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

Delegation of Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee Leaves
   Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by its Vice-Chairman Hwang Yong Bo left here Saturday by air to participate in the 43rd General Assembly of the Asia-Pacific Broadcasting Union.
